page.title: 13Old R.A.F Finstock
page.content: The aerodrome has been deserted since the Second World War. It looks like a ghost town from a cowboy movie, mounds of earth over the concrete runway, plastic bags being blown about in the wind, grass growing through the different colours of the worn out runway. Today ox-eye daisy, cranes bill, moss and yorkshire fog grow there. Many years ago the ruined red brick control tower may have looked like a fire station practice tower. Once there would have been a radar and radio in the glass top. The stairs inside the control tower has seen better days, once looking like a metal fire escape, now rusted through. The aerodrome is now peaceful, with birds twittering instead of the roar of aeroplanes.
